DataElement.preferredName: Person Specimen Malignant Neoplasm Research Consent Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/NA indicator related to the consent or permission from a person to use a portion of blood, tissue, or other substance from the body in cancer research, the systematic investigation of the nature of diseases in which abnormal cells divide without control.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Specimen Malignant Neoplasm Research Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the consent or permission from a person to use a portion of blood, tissue, or other substance from the body in cancer research, the systematic investigation of the nature of diseases in which abnormal cells divide without control.

Property.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, to establish or revise a theory, or to develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, to establish or revise a theory, or to develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/NA indicator related to the consent by a patient to participate in a clinical trial.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did the patient consent to Ti
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient consent to Tissue Procurement for cancer research

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to have blood collected after surgery during follow-up period of study. The patient's coded sample(s) and related coded information may be used to learn about, prevent, find or treat the patient's type of cancer. This may also include research on inherited traits (genes passed on in families).
